greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Divide n by the largest primorial that divides it and repeat until a fixed point is reached; a(n) is the fixed point.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..30030
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
formula: If A111701(n) == n, then a(n) = n, otherwise a(n) = a(A111701(n)).
program: A111701(n) = forprime(p=2, , if(n%p, return(n), n /= p));
xref: Cf. A007814 (gives the number of iterations to reach a fixed point), A025487 (indices of 1's).
Cf. also A093411 for analogous sequence.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 19 2019
ext: Definition clarified by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 19 2021
